Comment: Researchers refer people talking in different accents and slang depending on the group to which they're trying to appeal as "code switching".  On a benign level, this is done as part of social context. You don't speak to your boss the way you speak to your family, for instance.  On a malicious level, it's done by politicians, pop stars, etc. to try to appeal to them on their level. Reference John Kerry asking, "Can I get me a hunting license here?"
